item.title: Make Your 2020 General Election Predictions Here!
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
36 minutes ago, Hardkill said:

So, then how did Obama in 2008 end up winning 365 electoral votes when he had less of a lead back then than Biden does now in the polls (Biden will also probably win the popular vote by a much greater margin than Obama did back then)?

What about in 2012 when Obama won 332 electoral votes, but ended up only leading the polling average by about 1 point over Romney back then whereas Biden has consistently shown to have the largest polling average lead ever since the very beginning of the existence of scientific polls for elections, which was 1936? 

Was it Obama's charisma that had him defy the polls that much? I am not sure that I totally buy that.

Maybe, I am wrong. Though, I am unclear as to what I am saying here would be incorrect.

Trump is a unique devil that brings out the devil in half the population. And it's hard to poll devilry. So this is a unique election.

I am automatically assuming that Trump is 2-3% underrepresented in the polls. If not, then Biden will get a landslide victory of epic proportions. It will be a Blue Tsunami.

item.title: Understanding relativism
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
23 minutes ago, Mvrs said:

If we as humans had thought of something other than atoms completely different than atoms it would have ended up being true .

No, it doesn't work so simply.

"Atoms" are entangled with your state of consciousness, with your neurology, with your DNA, and many other such factors which you cannot simply change at will.

If you could change your state of consciousness, your neurology, and your DNA -- then yes, atoms would become something else.

38 minutes ago, Talinn said:

My main critique is that I'm unconvinced it takes this long to deconstruct science. You did a good job in the first 1-2 hours, there was no need to drag it past that in my opinion. I'll watch the other videos, but I believe they will just beat a dead horse.

item.title: Leo what you mean when you say "I'm looking through your eyes right now"?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Javfly33 If you ever become conscious enough, you will realize I am you, and that your entire life I have been looking through your eyes.

I am precisely identical to you.

Don't imagine that Leo is seeing what he's seeing plus also seeing what you're seeing. That's wrong. Instead, imagine that Leo is only seeing what you are seeing!

But that is too much for you to imagine. It doesn't make to your ego.

item.title: The problem with radical open-mindedness
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
6 hours ago, Someone here said:

You can't be open minded to something that goes against your direct experience.

Of course you can. Your direct experience is limited. It can expand. Hence you should be open to that.

6 hours ago, Someone here said:

How do I test the concept of "others are imaginary"? In my direct experience I can't for example undo or unimagine you. 

Psychedelic is the easiest way. Or through lots of meditation and awakening.

item.title: The problem with radical open-mindedness
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

You adopt radical openmindedness while simultaneously doing serious reasearch, consuming quality sources of info, reading, doing practices, and testing everything.

Radical openmindedness is not a license to adopt a bunch of untested New Age beliefs. You test ruthlessly, as is the spirit of science.

item.title: If reality is infinite - wouldn't it include a possibility of eternal suffering?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
4 minutes ago, Frenk said:

@Leo Gura What's more terrifying is that when it hits you it feels like it will last for Eternity, not some vague feeling, but like 1000% truth. If someone told me its going to end in xx time then i wouldn't mind it as much tbh

That's where surrender comes in.

Once you surrender, the suffering subsides. If you keep resisting it, it will persist.

If you ever get caught in horrible, off-the-chart suffering, you will have no choice but to surrender, and that's how you'll get through it. Surrender is the grace of God.

item.title: If reality is infinite - wouldn't it include a possibility of eternal suffering?

in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

But still, finite suffering can be horrific. Just because suffering is finite doesn't really make it any more pleasant.

item.title: Our „Reality“ = Unconscious guilt?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
35 minutes ago, The Don said:

Why does love exist?

Funny enough, it turns out that Love is the only thing that can exist.

22 minutes ago, bensenbiz said:

Thanks for you quick respond. I dont get „Love vs Fear“ in that context. 
Could you describe it a bit more please?

Fear is what keeps you in the lower realms of consciousness, from Infinite Love.

You're afraid of it. The finite is afraid of the infinite.

It's very simple and elegant in how it works.

item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
56 minutes ago, DefinitelyNotARobot said:

Unless your name is Trump in which case you should rant as much as humanly possible!

Actually it seemed to backfire on Trump. Most people were turned off by his ranting.

When you rant, it's preaching the choir. It makes your loyalists happy, but it doesn't convert any new people to your movement.

That's one of the reasons I've had to dial back my rants. If it wasn't for this, my rants would be off the hook, Lewis Black style.

1000+ hours.

item.title: Let's get Sean Carroll on Actualized.org for a discussion about Science
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
10 hours ago, Petals said:

@Leo Gura how about Bernardo Kastrup? He is interviewed by channels much smaller than Actualized.org. He has his PhDs but is not dependent on academia for his money or reputation. In fact, he criticizes academia quite a lot. He is an advocator of idealism, he's open to psychedelics, etc. I think he is a very good fit (if you think about an interview at all).

He would agree with everything I say. So it's not going to convince anyone.

The problem is someone within the traditional paradigm is needed, but he also has to be openminded. It's like looking for a hen with teeth.

item.title: 2 epistemic questions that have been bugging me: relates to Leo's psych experiment vd
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
2 hours ago, Eren Eeager said:

@Leo Gura Leo , we  use logic when explaining God, like God divided himself or God is nothing so it can be everything, so I was wondering what makes this logic we use in explaining God any legit. Is not God beyond logic?

Actually, God is pretty logical, but God's logic is of a higher order than any human logic. God's logic is transcendental, absolute, and really twisted, involving all sorts of contradictions and impossibilities.

A finite mind has a finite logic.

An infinite mind has an infintie logic.

in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

item.title: My hand is a hand
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
20 minutes ago, Samuel Garcia said:

Isn't seeing and feeling my hand proof I have a hand? I may not know even if there is a material hand there, but I know the perceptions of the hand, so if I am honest I can at least say I can perceive (feel and see) this hand? Although the hand is a label. Or is the label ''my hand'' already too much?

And when I lose attention of my hand, perhaps I can say I do not know of my hand in my direct experience. But then my attention goes back to my hand. 

Why don't you believe that your hand exists one moment and doesn't exist the next? Then it is created the next. This more reflects your experience. Yet you believe in a permanent physical hand.

Quote

''I have a hand'' maybe a belief, but that belief stops my hand getting hurt and protects me, and allows me to use it. So what is the big problem with the belief of my hand?

And what is the problem when Nazis believe that Jews are like cockroaches? It helps protect white Nazi purity from being poluted by those dirty Jews.

Hey, as long as you are surviving, what's wrong with lies? If I steal your money by lying to you, what's wrong with that? I can buy myself a nice car. Great, right?

item.title: Why shouldn't I kill someone, steal something, etc.
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

Good and bad are always relative to the ego's survival.

Ego's death = bad

Ego's survival = good

Devilry 101

in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
2 hours ago, EmptyVase said:

Yes, ultimately everything is imagination. But climbing down a few levels of metaphysics, what's going on with these seemingly coexisting dreams?

What's going on is, all others are imagined by your mind, and you are the one and only God. Sitting there alone.

You will NEVER make sense of this logically.

Take psychedelic to save yourself 10 years of BS.

item.title: My hand is a hand
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
1 hour ago, from chaos into self said:

Isn’t saying my hand is a hand a name, not a belief?

That's a name.

But you also believe you have a hand.

Like, if you are talking to me and I tell you that you don't have a hand, you will object that you in fact do -- even if you don't have a direct experience of your hand in that moment.

A better example here would be the brain. You believe you have a brain.

item.title: What does Leo have to say about the paranormal?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
6 minutes ago, Preety_India said:

If I were in Las Vegas right now I'd have touched Leo and proved that he exists in real 

C'mon now, can't argue that he is real.

Back in the 1800's an Irish philosopher, Bishop Berkeley (after whom was named UC Berkeley) argued that all physical objects do not exist because they are imaginary. His argument was so powerful that none of his colleagues could refute it. Finally, after trying and trying all day long, exasperated, one of his colleagues, said, "To hell with this. I refute him thus..." and he kicked a rock.

God is so selfless that God cannot bask in full enlightenment forever, hence creating the finite world. Ta-da!

item.title: What does Leo have to say about the paranormal?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
5 minutes ago, PurpleTree said:

Yeah but there are levels to this, dreams in dreams in dreams like inception.

Actually, no. There is only one dream. This right NOW.

Quote

This dream here i always come back to and it is very gradually/steadily, i could build a house here and live in it for 30 yrs.

Other dreams in this dream are very fleeting and gone in seconds.

This is a dream. The one dream of NOW.

You are imagining all those other dreams.

Flatten reality down to a single layer. And then flatten it even more until even the 1st layer becomes nothing.

item.title: Will my presence ever die?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
14 minutes ago, Member said:

Yes but there is no end to existence. Existence ceasing to exist forever is not possible, I guess. So do you think that a being can achieve total understanding and break the cycle of samsara to never reincarnate again? Is it possible that existence can become aware of itself to such degree that death or whatever expression it takes can be imagined consciously? Including forgetting about being complete and re-entering the Matrix?

I'm not totally sure about that.

I suspect that permanent liberation is actually impossible. If you awaken, you must eventually at some point forget your awakening in order to complete the circle.

Whatever happens, reality must cycle back to itself, to every point at which you existed.

One day, you will find yourself back to exactly where you are sitting now. And that day is today! Ta-da!

item.title: Question on The Nature of Consciousness

well i mean if dmt beings are "real" then these sleep paralysis demons are real too.

item.title: About enlightenment, truth realization, abiding non dual awareness
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
2 minutes ago, Javfly33 said:

Then what´s the point on the work? If ego´s desires are not important, and Truth doesn´t care in being awake or not, then I suppose you should be totally fine in living in delusion 100% of the time withouth ever waking up

You will say, "But ego can't get those things!"

item.title: What does Leo have to say about the paranormal?

in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
1 minute ago, PurpleTree said:

any thoughts on sleep paralysis?

i used to have that a lot. i know the scientific explanation is = the body is locked and the brain is half dreaming etc.

What thoughts do you want?

It's a thing. Consciousness can dream up infinite things. What of it?

item.title: About enlightenment, truth realization, abiding non dual awareness
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
2 minutes ago, electroBeam said:

@Leo Gura the thing is though, the only way to know the truth is to BE it. Because any other way is grasping, which is impossible. You can't know/BE the truth by trying to take some diluted memory of a 5 minute trip back to a dualistic framework. Because that's just being a dualistic framework with a cool memory. So the only way for the truth to know itself is to abide by it. The truth can't know/be itself in disunity, that's literally what disunity is. 

Except I know precisely what Truth is. I'm it now and always.

It isn't just a memory, it's lesson for now. Similar to how if stick your hand in the fire when you are 10 years old for 5 seconds, 20 years later you still know that fire is hot.

You assume that psychedelics don't change you, but they do. It's just subtle.

item.title: Question on The Nature of Consciousness
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
11 minutes ago, toocrazytobecrazy said:

do you also think brain also functions as emotions,sensations? 

emotions and sensations could be higher but more wave like level of our computation. i am tryna say emotions and mind are not in a seperate system, rather seperate methods of computation in same system which is brain.

you referred to this as rational+ or something like this in your last video.

Your entire paradigm is completely wrong.

There are no levels to reality. This is it. As soon as you start thinking the question, "But what causes this? And what causes that?" you've already fallen into dualistic delusion. Don't go looking for hidden causes. There are no causes. Reality is uncaused.

Things don't really cause each other, rather the entire Universe exists all at once without any cause. BOOM! EVERYTHING! AT ONCE! Directly! Via no process or method.

If you're trying to track down some process by which experience is being created, you've already fucked up. You have to realize that that entire line of inquiry is wrong because it is dualistic.

You did not arrive at this moment by being born some number of years ago. You have always been here, imagining you were born some years ago. Here you are. Your entire life backstory is imaginary. It never happened. You just think it did.

item.title: What does Leo have to say about the paranormal?

in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Leo Gura you completely exist in full body form.. I can basically touch you right now and prove that you exist.

item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
3 minutes ago, Preety_India said:

@Leo Gura so your opinion is that ghosts are just a figment of the imagination?

Be very careful. I am a figment of your imagination.

The floor your are sitting on is a figment of your imagination. So.... don't poo-poo imagination.

An imaginary ghost could still bite your ass, since your ass is also imaginary

item.title: What does Leo have to say about the paranormal?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
6 minutes ago, Preety_India said:

@Leo Gura I'm talking about phenomenon like ghosts. Do you believe in ghosts and do you think that we need a different tool to study the occurrence of such phenomenon?

Consciousness can imagine ghosts and a million other things, just like it does with animals and people.

Some "paranormal" phenomena cannot be studied using conventional materialistic methods.

I've never met a ghost so I don't know if material methods would work on them. Probably not.

Basically, for you to meet a ghost would require that you have a different brain chemistry than ordinary humans. You need a brain chemistry which will allow your consciousness to imagine ghosts.

item.title: About enlightenment, truth realization, abiding non dual awareness
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
36 minutes ago, electroBeam said:

why would truth not care about unifying with itself?

Because Truth is EVERYTHING, including non-abidance and disunity.

Quote

and aren't you into sober methods for abidance?

Sure, but I'm not hung up on it like some folks are. I don't discount nonduality just because it lasts 5 minutes. 5 minutes of nonduality is just as true and valid as 50 years of it. Because actually it's Eternal.

item.title: Question on The Nature of Consciousness
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
29 minutes ago, SamueLSD said:

If not the brain, what is physiology ? 

You're missing the simple fact that brain is mind.

Quote

I don't imagine its necessary for consciousness. However, if someone were to remove my frontal lobe, would it not change something? Proving that it is necessary for my mind to operate? 

Of course it would change something. Again: mind affects mind.

In a novel, if you cut off a character's legs, that affects his whole story arc. He can no longer run around as before. But it does not prove the reality of legs or the character.

Quote

I was stuck on thinking that you and many others meant there is no such thing as 'indirect' consciousness, and there is only my direct experience. Which I now know is not the case. Thanks.

No, you got it backwards.

There is only your experience. Nothing else. All others are part of your direct experience. The experiences of others is imagined by your mind.

item.title: Question on The Nature of Consciousness
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
32 minutes ago, SamueLSD said:

Question: Then how come physiology directly affects our mind?  

Physiology IS mind. Mind affects mind.

Do you have a problem with atoms affecting atoms? No

Then why do you have a problem with mind affecting mind?

Atoms are mind affecting mind. Mind imagines a proton. Mind imagines an electron. Mind imagines proton affecting the electron. Mind imagines motion. Easy.

Quote

There is only consciousness, but I am not directly conscious of my brain and it still seems to be 'there'. 

It isn't there. You are stuck imagining it's there and that it's necessary.

Quote

I'll put it another way: I am not directly conscious of  Sagittarius A*, however it still holds our sun and many other stars within its orbit, creating the milky way.  

All of that is just a fantasy in your mind that you just imagined. Pure concept.

Quote

Or am I actually consciously creating those things on a level of awareness that I cannot reach within the mind?

OF COURSE!

Quote

What is the metaphysical / epistemological explanation for this?? What am I missing?

You're missing the obvious: this is a dream. It works exactly like a dream. Wake up.

in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
34 minutes ago, Etherial Cat said:

If I could be disgusted by these experience on a personal level, why can't I cringe in disgust when its Giuliani ?

Personally I think Giuliani is a ghoul. But that does not mean I will buy into Sacha's fraud. Framing people is wrong, even if they happen to be ghouls.

item.title: Outsourcing Your(My) Actualization to Leo.
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

It's very simple. All my insights are useless unless you re-derive them for yourself.

It's like you're in training to become a surgeon and all you do is attend lectures but you're too lazy to ever pick up a knife. How do you think that will work? I'm not gonna hold the knife for you.

The point of my talks is to make you aware of what's possible to discover IF YOU WORK AT IT.

Well even if Jed did tell you its love, that wouldn't help ya.

I've seen many people who follow Jed's teachings argue with me and deny that Love = Truth. Because after reading his work they get the idea that everything is simply nothing and love is just some New Agey bullshit for those who don't pursue real enlightenment.

Setting proper expectations is important.

I even gave you guys a 15 minute magic pill for realizing Love. If you dare to use it.

People say my teachings are all talk. Actually, my teachings are full of the most powerful techniques on Earth. But no one uses them.

item.title: Why shouldn't I kill someone, steal something, etc.
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
31 minutes ago, Nthnl said:

what i should and shouldn't do.

That's exactly the problem. You want to turn Goodness into a dumb mechanical process, but it cannot ever be that because Goodness is Infinite Consciousness/Intelligence.

Goodness, Consciousness, Intelligence, Love, Truth, and Infinity cannot ever be formalized into any finite system of rules or methods.

Which means...

If you want to be Good, you must constantly be conscious in every situation. You cannot coast your way there. If you try to create a formal mechanical method for Goodness, you will instead create evil.

So what you are asking is how to create evil. Which all the religions have done. A religion is a mechanical method for reaching Goodness. Which is actually evil.

The whole point of being Good is that there is absolutely no reason why you can't or shouldn't kill a basket of puppies. And yet you choose not to. Which makes you Good.

item.title: Final 2020 Presidential Debate
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
14 minutes ago, Origins said:

foreign bank account (perfectly normal in international business)

This is BS.

It is not normal for a President to not disclose all his financial holdings and accounts. Presidents are obligated to disclose foreign bank accounts and Trump failed to include in this legal diaclosure documents upon assuming the office. Obviously he did that because it makes him look real bad and hypocritical.

Presidents are not allowed to have such conflicts of interest. This is corruption 101. Stop normalizing it. It is not okay for a US President to pay more taxes to the Chinese feds than the US feds. That's anti-American as fuck. Trump is literally stealing millions from Federal public coffers while pretending to be a patriot.

1st rule of being a patriot: pay your damn taxes.

item.title: I don’t know much about Politics, but why is Biden any better than Trump?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
4 hours ago, Abdelghafar said:

With all due respect, Leo, if what you say is not judgement, then what is the definition of judgement according to you? or it doesn't even exist, it's just an illusion or a projection of the person labelling it as such?

@Leo Gura

Judgment is:

A charged emotional reaction against a thing because you believe it is objectively wrong and should not exist.

But see, I know that all wrong is relative and untrue. When I say something negative about someone it is a relative statement. So, for example, I'm not stupid enough to believe that my opinions of Trump are somehow objectively true. They are an expression of my biased survival agenda. And I have no personal hate or resentment towards any evil in the world. Since I know it's actually all Love/Good.

So if you show me the greatest evil ever, I will see it as simply the greatest Love.

But I will still call out Trump on his BS, because that too is part of Love/Good.

item.title: About enlightenment, truth realization, abiding non dual awareness
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
3 hours ago, The0Self said:

Wait. But if truth is everything, everything being of course synonymous with no-thing, how can it exist? Maybe we have different ideas of existence. Or maybe you’re coming from the perspective of understanding. I’m not, for what it’s worth. Or maybe there is no truth, and that’s the truth, like you suggested could hypothetically be the case (only in the sense that you were describing a syllogism for grammatical purposes, but still).

And yes, no-thing (everything) is obviously unconditional love.

You simply have never been directly conscious of what Truth is. So you are confused.

Trust me. It exists. HERE. IT. IS.

But hey, feel free to deny it. Truth don't mind.

Maybe Giuliani is a horny perv, but this clip is not a valid proof.

And honestly, who Giuliani hits on or tries to have sex with is none of our business as long as he isn't violating any laws. Which he isn't since this is obviously not some underage girl. If Giuliani wants to flirt with a 25 year old, have at it. And if she is cool with him taking off his pants, that's her problem.

Sasha's whole MO is to make people look as bad as humanly possible for laughs.

This is no different than doctored videos of Joe Biden or Nancy Pelosi that right-wingers share on Facebook to delude themselves.

item.title: Isn't "the planet mars is a belief" a belief?

in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
2 hours ago, Mikael89 said:

isn't it a belief that the planet mars is a belief?

If you actually bothered to introspect, you'd see that this is false.

"The planet mars is a belief" is NOT a belief. It is a direct experience.

You should introspect about what a belief is.

Quote

So I kinda got surprised that he didn't say the thing which I'm talking about. It's like he stopped too early, didn't go far enough.

You went too far.

But also not far enough in introspection. You're not actually carefully introspecting, you're parroting ideas that sound plausible to you.

Introspect more carefully about what a belief is, and how to tell when something is a belief or not.

item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
7 hours ago, Mannyb said:

“The ultimate truth is that all judgment and criticism is pure delusion and ignorance.

Criticizing anything in reality is idiotic because reality is Absolute Love. It cannot be anything better nor can it be different.

The only reason anyone criticizes anything is because their perceptive is too small.“

Hehe. A little devilry from my part here. In all honesty, from a broader perspective Trump plays an important role in the global awakening. Shaking things up and exposing the loopholes and limitations of our current system, as well as the general contempt which held us down. 

I made a statement of observation, not personal moral judgment.

You guys have a hard time distinguishing between when I say something negative about someone vs me judging them.

If someone is a murderer, saying they're a murderer is not a judgment or criticism.

item.title: Pulling Yourself Through Stuff
item.description:
in Life Purpose, Career, Entrepreneurship

Set fewer goals, but bigger, more juicier goals and then latch onto them like a pitbull and never let go until they are actualized.

Without that pitbull attitude, you won't get far. You must be unwilling to yield to failure. Simply refuse to let failure stop you. But for that to work you need a worthwhile goal.

item.title: the answer for the question ''What if you're not good at the life purpose you want''
item.description:
in Life Purpose, Career, Entrepreneurship

You should distinguish whether it's within your domain of strength. That doesn't mean you have to be good at it, but it has to fit what you have knack for.

In your case your thing might not be the engineering but the vision, creative direction, management, and business side. Engineering work is easily outsourced to experts while you handle the hardest part: creative direction.

If your knack is for creative direction and management, DO NOT go into engineering. This would be huge mistake. On the other hand, if your knack is for technical detail, then DO NOT go into management.

item.title: How will I know that I've escaped wage slavery?
item.description:
in Life Purpose, Career, Entrepreneurship

If you work for a fixed salary set by a boss, you're a wage slave.

The point is to set up a situation where your salary has no ceiling.

item.title: Collecting Questions & Objections About The Limits Of Science
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
23 minutes ago, SonataAllegro said:

The method, though, is an invaluable skill that, if directed inward, will transform your life.

Scientific method is a myth. No such thing exists. There cannot be a finite method for investigating reality, since reality is infinite.

This series will deconstruct this myth.

item.title: The 5-MeO-DMT Mega-Thread
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
9 hours ago, sethx said:

hey @Leo Gura I watched your video about your 30 day experiment. Holy shit.

I have a question.. You mentioned you always went to the the bathtub at the height of your experience and that you don't black out.

Could you explain? I mean, it knocked me out of my socks no matter how low the dosage, so what's going on here? Were you "mini-dosing" ? Could you share some specifics, please?

Mini-dosing? Lol. I was mega-dosing. 25-30mgs towards the end of the experiment. And even a few back to back double-doses.

What's going on is that I have a special brain and special mind which responds differently to psychedelics than most humans.

Stop assuming that everyone is the same. That's your error.

item.title: How is the map not the territory?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
39 minutes ago, Nahm said:

Imagine an image of a map of your house on the wall, coming from a projector. The map would be of the house, and could be said to be in the house, but also wouldn’t be existing.

And furthermore imagine that this house was in your dream

item.title: How is the map not the territory?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Obviously the map is the territory.

But also, it isn't.

The first step is to realize the map is not the territory. Which will take you a decade of work.

The next step is to realize the map is the territory. Which will take you another decade of work.

in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Ayahausca certainly ain't legal in Florida. People create all sorts of fake "legal" retreats. Doesn't change the fact that DMT is schedule 1 substance. Don't be dumb. Just cause some dude advertises something as legal doesn't mean that it is.

item.title: When I die..
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Death cannot be explained to an ego because ego is the belief that there is something to die.

Without ego, you are just Eternal Infinity forever conscious of itself.

The only thing that dies is the idea that you are human.

item.title: Found out I have Hashimoto's disease
item.description:
in Health, Fitness, Nutrition

There are so many different factors when it comes to thyroid. My case is not fixed with any medication or diet.

And in the long-term, taking that hormone is not addressing the root cause of your thyroid autoimmune attack. As long as you have those anitbodies, your body is attacking and destroying your thyroid gland.

You should look into stuff like heavy metal toxicity and liver detox to really get at the root cause.

item.title: Why are spiritual teachers against psychedelics?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
2 minutes ago, electroBeam said:

@Leo Gura I don't agree with that passage, but you don't know whether Truth = Love in his mind. He did not explicitly say Truth != Love. 

Edit: woops, somehow missed some sentences.

But he frames the pursuit of Love as some New Age spiritual lark -- a distraction from enlightenment.

That is highly misleading.

I cannot read teachers' minds, so I judge them on their public teachings.

Any enlightenment teacher that does not say the word Love, is missing something very important.
